name: pyradiomics
description: Extract radiomic features from medical images using PyRadiomics. This method calculates quantitative imaging features from a region of interest (ROI) defined by a mask. It supports various feature classes including first-order statistics, shape features, texture features (GLCM, GLRLM, GLSZM, GLDM, NGTDM), and wavelet features. The method requires both the original image and a binary mask defining the ROI. Output includes comprehensive radiomic features organized by feature class.

parameters.name: mask_base64
parameters.description: Mask image encoded in base64 (NIfTI format). If provided, this mask will be used instead of the mask file input. This is useful when passing masks directly from previous method outputs (e.g., lungmask).

parameters.name: feature_classes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of feature classes to extract. Options: 'firstorder', 'shape', 'glcm', 'glrlm', 'glszm', 'gldm', 'ngtdm', 'wavelet'. Default: 'firstorder,shape,glcm,glrlm,glszm,gldm,ngtdm' (all except wavelet).

parameters.name: bin_width
parameters.description: Bin width for intensity discretization. Default: 25.

parameters.name: normalize
parameters.description: Normalize image intensities before feature extraction. Default: false.

parameters.name: normalize_scale
parameters.description: Scale factor for normalization (if normalize=true). Default: 100.
